Package com.github.skopylov58.functional

Interface Either<L,R>

Type Parameters:
L - left side type
R - right side type
All Known Implementing Classes:
Either.Left, Either.Right
public sealed interface Either<L,R> permits Either.Left<L,R>, Either.Right<L,R>
Minimal functional Either implementation.

It does not have left or right projections, map/flatMap/filter operations work only on right side of Either and do not have effect for left side. Anyway you can use swap() for this purpose.

Either has a set of catching(CheckedConsumer) helper methods which will be useful for exception handling. 

    catching(() -> new Socket("foo", 1234))
       .flatMap(catching(Socket::getOutputStream))
       .flatMap(catching(o -> {
        o.write(new byte[] {1,2,3});
 }));
